choice.title: vprobe-toolkit
choice.description: The core toolkit which includes the Emmett compiler, VProbe app (python), and a collection of utility scripts.

{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf1038\cocoasubrtf360 {\fonttbl\f0\fnil\fcharset0 LucidaGrande;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;\red18\green0\blue238;} \deftab720 \pard\pardeftab720\ql\qnatural
\f0\fs24 \cf0 VProbes is a safe, dynamic technology for transparently instrumenting a powered-on guest operating system, its currently running processes, and VMware's virtualization software. VProbes provides both dynamically and statically defined probes. You can find more detailed documentation for VProbes at the {\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "http://communities.vmware.com/community/vmtn/developer/forums/vprobes"}}{\fldrslt \cf2 \ul \ulc2 community website}}.\ \pard\tx560\pardeftab720\ql\qnatural \cf0 \ \pard\pardeftab720\ql\qnatural \cf0 This Toolkit provides an interactive, programmer-friendly interface to VProbes. It allows you to write instrumentation scripts using a C-like high-level language called Emmett which is a replacement for the more primitive VP language native to VProbes. In a few steps, the installer will copy the binaries and utility scripts to /usr/local/bin.\ \pard\tx560\pardeftab720\ql\qnatural \cf0 \ The Toolkit source code is hosted at {\field{\*\fldinst{HYPERLINK "http://github/vmware/vprobe-toolkit/"}}{\fldrslt http://github/vmware/vprobe-toolkit/}}}
